title: Clergy Profile Template
description: Defines the clergy structure of a religion including prerequisites, training path, ranks, duties, vestments, privileges, and restrictions. Clergy combat readiness should reflect the deity's nature.

clergy_title.description: What clergy members are called (priest, cleric, monk, etc.)

prerequisites.description: Requirements to become clergy (beauty, virginity, profession, literacy, supernatural ability)

acceptance_process.description: How candidates are evaluated and accepted

rank_structure.description: Rank structure from novice to highest rank

duties.description: General duties (marriages, burials, counseling, military chaplain)

blood_spilling_rules.description: Rules about weapons that draw blood

combat_readiness.description: Combat capabilities -- should reflect the deity's nature

role_in_society.description: Social role and influence of clergy

x-cross-references.religion-profile: This clergy serves a religion defined in a Religion Profile
x-cross-references.god-profile: Clergy combat readiness reflects the god's nature
x-cross-references.armed-forces-profile: Military clergy may overlap with armed forces
